nodes.bodyText: Technically it is correct. Since we follow fluent style in most of our translators, maybe we can do it here as well.

This annotation is custom one, not a jackson annotation, so it has no effect on the MixIn. Also, it turns out that PoolDTO did not need these annotations anyway, because there was no corresponding "PoolFilter" when configuring the ObjectMapper in JsonProvider.java, thus the @JsonFilter("PoolFilter") and the @Hateoas* annotations on it did not work anyway. They only work for the model entity (Pool.java) because the Event ObjectMapper is configured to look for a "PoolFilter", and they were accidentally copied over to PoolDTO when we implemented that.
So we should remove all 4 @Hateoas annotations and their fields from here.

nodes.bodyText: ProvidedProductDTO should probably also be added the DynamicPropertyFilterMixIn here

nodes.bodyText:
The PoolDTO.productId field is not currently validated upon (the ProvidedProductDTO.productId is, and it rightly has it as required), so this section is not required at all on PoolDTO.
Also, if we were to need required fields, this is the wrong place for this element (it does not result in @notNull annotation being generated. it would have to be under allOf: -type: object (at the same level as the properties: element) for it to work. This is something I noticed we did in ContentDTO, and we should fix (move the required: element at the same level as properties:)
